174.title: "George Herriman et son Oeuvre"
174.author: Richard Marschall ; traduit de l'américain par Yohan Radomski
174.appears_in: p. 78-85 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 2 (Jan. 1997).
notes: (Krazy Herriman)
From America's Great Comic Strip Artists (Abbeville Press, 1989), p. 97-119.

Begins: "L'histoire de George Herriman ne se confond pas avec celle de Krazy Kat. Il est peu connu qu'avant son chef-d'oeuvre (et même en parallèle avec lui, pendant une grande partie de sa vie), Herriman dessina beaucoup d'autres séries dans les quotidiens. La grande qualité de ses nombreux autres strips n'a pas été suffisamment appréciée."

English summary (from p. 137): "George Herriman and His Work: Before creating the immortal Krazy Kat, George Herriman, an artist of Creole origin, had already given life to about twenty other comic strips, most of them short-lived. Richard Marschall retraces this little know period of his life, and touches on his personality. He emphasizes Herriman's exceptional intelligence of the essential principles and rhythm of daily strips, then delivers a scholarly report on the Krazy Kat's first appearance in the margin of another series, and its emancipation."

273.heading: Georges et Louis Romanciers--Articles About.
273.title: "Daniel dans la Fosse aux Romans"
273.author: Vincent Baudoux
273.appears_in: p. 8-13 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 3 (Jan. 1998).
notes: (À propos de Goossens, de Georges et de Louis)

English summary (from p. 138): "Daniel in the Novelist's Den: Daniel Goossens, president of the 25th Comics Festival of Angoulême, has been publishing work in the monthly Fluide Glacial for twenty years. He has been acclaimed as one of the most original humourists of his generation, as well as a virtuoso in the art of drawing. Vincent Baudoux decyphers Goossens' vision of literature as seen in his recent series Georges et Louis Romanciers, in which two bad writers discuss possibilities for the plot of a novel."

274.heading: Georges et Louis Romanciers--Articles About.
274.title: "Georges et Louis sont dans un Bureau"
274.author: Thierry Groensteen p
274.appears_in: 13-18 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 3 (Jan. 1998).
notes: (À propos de Goossens, de Georges et de Louis)

English summary (from p. 138): "Georges and Louis are in an Office: In a deeper analysis of the same series, Thierry Groensteen demonstrates that Georges et Louis is a collision, and confusing, of four different themes: the novel, literary criticism, films, and comics. He explores the ways in which Goossens makes the subject of each episode into a copy of the idea the two writers are discussing in it. He also shows that Goossens' humour, while playing on the absurd, is not void of social concerns."
